query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 In forma dunque di candida rosa 2 mi si mostrava la milizia santa 3 che nel suo sangue Cristo fece sposa;

Please translate each line literally into English.
4 ma l’altra, che volando vede e canta 5 la gloria di colui che la ’nnamora 6 e la bontà che la fece cotanta,
query.result: 4 but the other, which flying sees and sings 5 the glory of Him who enamors it 6 and the goodness which made it so great,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 sì come schiera d’ape che s’infiora 8 una fïata e una si ritorna 9 là dove suo laboro s’insapora,
query.result: 7 like a troop of bees which flowers itself 8 at one moment and at another returns 9 to where its toil is savored,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 nel gran fior discendeva che s’addorna 11 di tante foglie, e quindi risaliva 12 là dove ’l süo amor sempre soggiorna.
query.result: 10 descended into the great flower which adorns itself 11 with so many petals, and then flew back up 12 to where its love always dwells.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Le facce tutte avean di fiamma viva 14 e l’ali d’oro, e l’altro tanto bianco, 15 che nulla neve a quel termine arriva.
query.result: 13 All their faces were of living flame, 14 and their wings of gold, and the rest so white, 15 that no snow reaches that limit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Quando scendean nel fior, di banco in banco 17 porgevan de la pace e de l’ardore 18 ch’elli acquistavan ventilando il fianco.
query.result: 16 When they descended into the flower, from bench to bench 17 they spread the peace and the ardor 18 that they acquired by fanning their sides.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Né l’interporsi tra ’l disopra e ’l fiore 20 di tanta moltitudine volante 21 impediva la vista e lo splendore:
query.result: 19 Nor did the interposition between the above and the flower 20 of such a flying multitude 21 impede the sight and the splendor:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 ché la luce divina è penetrante 23 per l’universo secondo ch’è degno, 24 sì che nulla le puote essere ostante.
query.result: 22 for the divine light is penetrating 23 through the universe according to how worthy it is, 24 so that nothing can obstruct it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Questo sicuro e gaudïoso regno, 26 frequente in gente antica e in novella, 27 viso e amore avea tutto ad un segno.
query.result: 25 This secure and joyful kingdom, 26 frequented by people of old and new, 27 had its gaze and love directed to one goal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 O trina luce che ’n unica stella 29 scintillando a lor vista, sì li appaga! 30 guarda qua giuso a la nostra procella!
query.result: 28 O threefold light which, sparkling in a single star, 29 so satisfies them with your sight! 30 Look down here at our tempest!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Se i barbari, venendo da tal plaga 32 che ciascun giorno d’Elice si cuopra, 33 rotante col suo figlio ond’ ella è vaga,
query.result: 31 If the barbarians, coming from such a region 32 that every day is covered by the constellation of the Great Bear, 33 rotating with its son around which it revolves,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 veggendo Roma e l’ardüa sua opra, 35 stupefaciensi, quando Laterano 36 a le cose mortali andò di sopra;

Please translate each line literally into English.
37 ïo, che al divino da l’umano, 38 a l’etterno dal tempo era venuto, 39 e di Fiorenza in popol giusto e sano,
query.result: 37 I, who had come to the divine from the human, 38 to the eternal from time, 39 and from Florence to a just and healthy people,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 di che stupor dovea esser compiuto! 41 Certo tra esso e ’l gaudio mi facea 42 libito non udire e starmi muto.
query.result: 40 with what astonishment should I have been filled! 41 Certainly between it and the joy I felt 42 I was pleased not to hear and to remain silent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 E quasi peregrin che si ricrea 44 nel tempio del suo voto riguardando, 45 e spera già ridir com’ ello stea,
query.result: 43 And like a pilgrim who takes pleasure 44 in gazing at the temple of his vow, 45 and already hopes to tell again how it stands,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 su per la viva luce passeggiando, 47 menava ïo li occhi per li gradi, 48 mo sù, mo giù e mo recirculando.
query.result: 46 I, walking through the living light, 47 turned my eyes over the tiers, 48 now up, now down, and now circling around.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Vedëa visi a carità süadi, 50 d’altrui lume fregiati e di suo riso, 51 e atti ornati di tutte onestadi.
query.result: 49 I saw faces sweetened by charity, 50 adorned with the light of others and with their own smiles, 51 and gestures graced with every virtue.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 La forma general di paradiso 53 già tutta mïo sguardo avea compresa, 54 in nulla parte ancor fermato fiso;

Please translate each line literally into English.
55 e volgeami con voglia rïaccesa 56 per domandar la mia donna di cose 57 di che la mente mia era sospesa.
query.result: 55 and I turned with rekindled desire 56 to ask my lady about things 57 on which my mind was suspended.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Uno intendëa, e altro mi rispuose: 59 credea veder Beatrice e vidi un sene 60 vestito con le genti glorïose.
query.result: 58 I was thinking of one thing, and she answered me about another: 59 I thought to see Beatrice and I saw an elder 60 clothed with the glorious people.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Diffuso era per li occhi e per le gene 62 di benigna letizia, in atto pio 63 quale a tenero padre si convene.
query.result: 61 His eyes and cheeks were suffused 62 with a benign joy, in a pious manner 63 as befits a tender father.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 E «Ov’ è ella?», sùbito diss’ io. 65 Ond’ elli: «A terminar lo tuo disiro 66 mosse Beatrice me del loco mio;

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 e se riguardi sù nel terzo giro 68 dal sommo grado, tu la rivedrai 69 nel trono che suoi merti le sortiro».
query.result: 67 and if you look up in the third circle 68 from the topmost tier, you will see her again 69 on the throne that her merits allotted her."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Sanza risponder, li occhi sù levai, 71 e vidi lei che si facea corona 72 reflettendo da sé li etterni rai.
query.result: 70 Without answering, I raised my eyes, 71 and I saw her who was making a crown for herself 72 by reflecting the eternal rays from herself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Da quella regïon che più sù tona 74 occhio mortale alcun tanto non dista, 75 qualunque in mare più giù s’abbandona,
query.result: 73 From that region which thunders highest 74 no mortal eye is as distant, 75 however far down into the sea one may plunge,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 quanto lì da Beatrice la mia vista; 77 ma nulla mi facea, ché süa effige 78 non discendëa a me per mezzo mista.

Please translate each line literally into English.
79 «O donna in cui la mia speranza vige, 80 e che soffristi per la mia salute 81 in inferno lasciar le tue vestige,
query.result: 79 "O lady in whom my hope flourishes, 80 and who endured for my salvation 81 to leave your footprints in Hell,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 di tante cose quant’ i’ ho vedute, 83 dal tuo podere e da la tua bontate 84 riconosco la grazia e la virtute.
query.result: 82 of all the things that I have seen, 83 I recognize the grace and the power 84 from your power and from your goodness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Tu m’hai di servo tratto a libertate 86 per tutte quelle vie, per tutt’ i modi 87 che di ciò fare avei la potestate.
query.result: 85 You have drawn me from servitude to liberty 86 through all those ways, through all those means 87 by which you had the power to do so.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 La tua magnificenza in me custodi, 89 sì che l’anima mia, che fatt’ hai sana, 90 piacente a te dal corpo si disnodi».
query.result: 88 Preserve your magnificence in me, 89 so that my soul, which you have made whole, 90 may be pleasing to you when it is untied from the body."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Così orai; e quella, sì lontana 92 come parea, sorrise e riguardommi; 93 poi si tornò a l’etterna fontana.

Please translate each line literally into English.
94 E ’l santo sene: «Acciò che tu assommi 95 perfettamente», disse, «il tuo cammino, 96 a che priego e amor santo mandommi,
query.result: 94 And the holy elder said, "In order that you may complete 95 your journey perfectly," he said, "to which 96 a holy prayer and love sent me,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 vola con li occhi per questo giardino; 98 ché veder lui t’acconcerà lo sguardo 99 più al montar per lo raggio divino.

Please translate each line literally into English.
100 E la regina del cielo, ond’ ïo ardo 101 tutto d’amor, ne farà ogne grazia, 102 però ch’i’ sono il suo fedel Bernardo».
query.result: 100 And the queen of heaven, for whom I burn 101 all with love, will grant us every grace, 102 because I am her faithful Bernard."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Qual è colui che forse di Croazia 104 viene a veder la Veronica nostra, 105 che per l’antica fame non sen sazia,
query.result: 103 Like one who perhaps comes from Croatia 104 to see our Veronica, 105 who is not sated by the ancient hunger,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 ma dice nel pensier, fin che si mostra: 107 ‘Segnor mio Iesù Cristo, Dio verace, 108 or fu sì fatta la sembianza vostra?’;
query.result: 106 but says in his thoughts, as long as it is shown: 107 'My Lord Jesus Christ, true God, 108 was your likeness really like this?'

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 tal era io mirando la vivace 110 carità di colui che ’n questo mondo, 111 contemplando, gustò di quella pace.
query.result: 109 such was I, gazing at the living 110 charity of him who, contemplating in this world, 111 tasted of that peace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 «Figliuol di grazia, quest’ esser giocondo», 113 cominciò elli, «non ti sarà noto, 114 tenendo li occhi pur qua giù al fondo;

Please translate each line literally into English.
115 ma guarda i cerchi infino al più remoto, 116 tanto che veggi seder la regina 117 cui questo regno è suddito e devoto».
query.result: 115 but look up to the outermost circles, 116 until you see the queen seated 117 to whom this kingdom is subject and devoted."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Io levai li occhi; e come da mattina 119 la parte orïental de l’orizzonte 120 soverchia quella dove ’l sol declina,
query.result: 118 I raised my eyes; and as in the morning 119 the eastern part of the horizon 120 surpasses that where the sun declines,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 così, quasi di valle andando a monte 122 con li occhi, vidi parte ne lo stremo 123 vincer di lume tutta l’altra fronte.
query.result: 121 so, as if going from a valley to a mountain 122 with my eyes, I saw a part at the extremity 123 surpassing all the other expanse with light.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 E come quivi ove s’aspetta il temo 125 che mal guidò Fetonte, più s’infiamma, 126 e quinci e quindi il lume si fa scemo,
query.result: 124 And as here where the pole is awaited 125 which Phaethon guided badly, it grows hotter, 126 and on this side and that the light grows dimmer,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 così quella pacifica oriafiamma 128 nel mezzo s’avvivava, e d’ogne parte 129 per igual modo allentava la fiamma;

Please translate each line literally into English.
130 e a quel mezzo, con le penne sparte, 131 vid’ io più di mille angeli festanti, 132 ciascun distinto di fulgore e d’arte.
query.result: 130 and at that center, with their wings outspread, 131 I saw more than a thousand angels rejoicing, 132 each distinguished by brilliance and artistry.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Vidi a lor giochi quivi e a lor canti 134 ridere una bellezza, che letizia 135 era ne li occhi a tutti li altri santi;

Please translate each line literally into English.
136 e s’io avessi in dir tanta divizia 137 quanta ad imaginar, non ardirei 138 lo minimo tentar di sua delizia.
query.result: 136 and if I had as much power in speech 137 as I have in imagination, I would not dare 138 to attempt the least bit of her delight.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Bernardo, come vide li occhi miei 140 nel caldo suo caler fissi e attenti, 141 li suoi con tanto affetto volse a lei,
query.result: 139 Bernard, when he saw my eyes 140 fixed and intent on his warm gaze, 141 turned his own to her with such affection,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 che ’ miei di rimirar fé più ardenti.
query.result: 142 that it made mine more ardent to behold her.
